S.FORM: lawkah cimu kahabaag! manaringay ta’ la.
S.TRANSL: 請起立! 向老師敬禮!
Please stand up! Salute the teacher!

S.FORM: ca’rux! tubunani i papasibaq!
lawkah su’ papasibaq!
tahunak.
tikuw papasibaq mu icimu kisa’ ga, nanuwan san ku nananiqun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家食物的泰雅語怎麼說。
Today the teacher is going to teach you how to talk about food.

S.FORM: baqun su’ kayi’ ni papasibaq quw?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: papasibaq, ini’ mu baqi. pakabalayq su’ kumaal lawwiy cu qutux quw?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。您可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ini’ mu pungi, karahuwal tikay ku kayi’ su’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，您講大聲一點好嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: kitaal i runi, galgiy kuwing i lumpuw cu qutux.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: yani! balayq cubalay ku linpuw mamu.
S.TRANSL: Yes! You have read it very well.

S.FORM: lpuw lawwiy cu qutux, karahuwal ku hanaang.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: ikiyang! laxi ku sangaquwaq!
agal ku ruwas.
uwal, papasibaq.
agal ku papateq.
papasibaq, ungian mu maras ku papateq la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: agal ku papawng cu pinateq.
papasibaq, ungian mu maras ku papawng cu pinateq la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kabawx cuku bays su’ cu papawng cu pinateq.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: kabaxay mu ku papawng cu pinateq su’ quw?
muhungiqay ta’ la.
pasikiaw ta’ i runi makibaq han, makitalay ta’ lawwiy i casan.
S.TRANSL: 我們就先學習到這邊，明天見。

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ su’?
ralu’ mu ga Lawsing na Yangah.
ima’ su’?
ulaqi’ kuwing ni Payan, ralu’ mu ga Hayung.
S.TRANSL: I’m Payan’s son, my name is Hayung.

S.FORM: ima’ su’?
Sayun a ralu’ mu, pasibaqan kuwing ni papasibaq Tayax.
S.TRANSL: My name is Sayun and I’m a student at Tayax.

S.FORM: lawkah yaba’, yaya’ quw?
lawkah naaba’, mahuway su’!
S.TRANSL: 爸爸媽媽都很平安健康，謝謝您！
Mom and Dad are safe and healthy, thank you!

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ ni yaba’ su’?
Baay na Payan ralu’ ni yaba’ mu.
ima’ i hiya’?
i hiya’ ga Hayung.
yulah mu ihya’, Bawnay ku ralu’ niya’.
S.TRANSL: He’s my brother, his name is Bawnay.

S.FORM: ima’ ralu’ niya’?
ralu’ niya’ ga Mayngus.
Mayngus ku ralu’ niya’ quw?
uwal, Mayngs ku ralu’ niya’.
Mayngus ku ralu’ niya’ quw?
iqaat, ralu’ niya’ ga Mawna’.
ima’ ku itaal ka haca?
hiya’ ga Kawban, yata’ mu ihya’.
ima’ ku itaal ka haca?
ihya’ ga rawin mu, ralu’ niya’ ga Bagan.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Bagan。
She’s a friend of mine, her name is Bagan.

S.FORM: piya’ a kaal su’ ka hani?
magalpuw a kaal mu ka hani.
piya’ a kaal niya’ ka hani la?
magalpuw cu rusa’ a kaal niya’ ka hani.
piya’ a kaal ni yaba’ su’ ka hani?
maymal kaal ni yaba’ mu ka hani.
papiya’ a matasasuwayi’ su’?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: kiya a caxa’ yulah mu, caxa’ iyah, ru’ caxa’ ku suwayi’ mu na kanayril.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，一個姊姊，和一個妹妹。
I have a brother, a sister, and a younger sister.

S.FORM: kiya yulah su’ quw?
ukas a yulah mu.
papiya’ cimu ka qutux cu imuwag?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: saspat cami ka qutux cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: kiya su’ mateq i inu’?
kiya kuwing mateq i papatiqan Tabilas.
S.TRANSL: I went to primary school in Wenshui.

S.FORM: ima’ i hiya’?
ihya’ ga mama’ mu.
nanuwan ku patuwawun ni mama’ su’?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: ihya’ ga kinsat.
ima’ ku itaal ka haca?
ihya’ ga iyah mu.
kiya i matwwaw iyah su’ quw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: kiya matwwaw i papakitalan cu muxaal.
matasasuwayi’ inha’ ka rarusa’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: iqaat, masirawin inha’.
Itaal su’ quw?
uwal, Itaal kuwing.
Itaal ku kanayril su’ quw?
uwal, asikinaga Amis ihya’.
ibabaweq i yaba’ su’ quw?
uwal, ibabaweq cami kahabaag ka qutux cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: mateq i suwayi’ su’ na kanayril laquw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: uwal, mateq la.
baaq kumaal cu kayi’ na Itaal ku suwasuwayi’ su’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 你的弟弟妹妹們會說族語嗎?
Do your brothers and sisters speak the language?

S.FORM: uwal, baaq kumaal cu kayi’ na Itaal naha’.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: papiya’ a matasasuwayi’ su’?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: tatwu’ cami ka matasasuwayi’.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: qutux kakian su’ ki yaba’ yaya’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: uwal ga, magluw kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: magluw su’ ki yutas, yaki’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini’, ini’ kuwing pagluw ki nha’.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: magluw su’ ki ima’ maqiyanux?
magluw kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’ ru yulah.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: minukahul su’ i inu’?
minukahul kuwing i Pa’nakuwali’.
kiya inu’ imuwag mamu?
kiya i Mabatuan ku imuwag niyam.
S.TRANSL: Our home is in Ching An.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ a tinqalangan su’?
kiya i Tinabulan ku tiqalangan mu.
kiya inu’ tinqalangan mamu?
kiya i Yawas ku tinqalangan niyam.
mausa’ su’ kanuwan i tinqalangan mamu?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: muhngeq kuwing i muhngeq gabagan ku papatiqan ga musa’ kuwing i tiqalangan.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: ulaqi’ kuwing na Itaal.
humicuwa’ a kaal sawni’?
pakahtuw a wagi’ la, makilux cubalay.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: gihaaq i latanux quw?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: gihaaq, kapayux masiyatu’ cu situwing.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: makilux i latanux quw?
ini’, sbayhuw la, tala’tu’ la.
humicuwa’ ku kaal sawni?
ini’ kagihaaq, ini’ uwiy uw kakilux sawni’, balayq cubalay a kisleq.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ a kaal gabiyan sawni?
ukas a hamhum i babaw na kaal, pakahtuw a buliquw la.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ a kaal i latanux?
yani na’ masuwat ku quwalax, matuwagi’ ru’ pakahtuw a hakri’ na utux la.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku kaal tagi ki cimu kiya?
sabayhuw cu mamati’ tagi ki cami i runi.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: balayq a kaal tagi ki isu’ quw?
balayq ga, rahuwal a wagi’.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: mausa’ kuwing i mateq la.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: tala’tu’ a kaal, kapayux masiyatu’ cu siyatu’.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: mausa’ kuwing i humhummakay.
S.TRANSL: I'm going out for a walk.

S.FORM: pakrahuwal a quwalax i kisa’, laxi ungi’ maras cu hawsuwa.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: paquwalax quw?
yani na’ mabicu sawni’, paquwalax cubalay kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: qumuwalax la quw?
quminuwalax sawni’, masuwat kahani la.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: qumuwalax la quw?
asiga quminuwalax la, mahuweq a raneq.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: quminuwalax quw? micuwa’ su’ ka asika huwehuweq?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: qumuwalax tagi latanux, ini’ kuwing aras cu hawsuwa.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: balayq su’ guw?
rahuwal ku bayhuw umiyup, muxaal a tunux mu.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: lawkah su’ quw?
mamati’ a wagi’, maimag siptukakayran mu na tunux.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: umungi’ ci maras cu papateq la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: kabaxanay mi su’.
umungi ci maras cu qaquway la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ini’ cu aras uwiy, halay ta’ mabaynay.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: halay ta’ i mabaynay cu papatas quw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: uwal, pabaynay kuwing na’ cu papawng cu pinatas.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: halay ta’ i mabaynay cu kaknamaun quw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: iyi’, minaneq ci imuwag la.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: ungian mu humakhuk ku sibileq mu la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: nabibuwiy musa’ pasmakilux ga!
ungian mu maras ku sibileq mu la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: nanu’ niqaw ta’ kawsa’ ku sibileq mu ga!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: nanuwan ku naniqun su’ i qaliyan?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: paqaneq kuwing cu naniqun na papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: paqaneq su’ cu nanuwan i qaliyan?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: maras kuwing cu sibileq sawni’, magalgay ta’ maneq i qaliyan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: halay ta’ i magunawu’ cu mari’ quw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play ball, shall we?

S.FORM: uwal! tila ga!
halay ta’ i tumuting cu mari’ quw?
iyi’, papateq kuwing.
alani kuwing cu cacaping han quw.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: uwal, biqanay misu’ ku cacapoh kahani.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: alani kuwing cu capang han quw?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: kiya kuwing cumapoh, alani kuwing kusa i Amuy.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Amuy to help you.

S.FORM: kiya kuwing cumaping, alani kuwing kusa i Amuy.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, ask Amuy to help you.

S.FORM: manaqru’ su’ cumapoh la quw?
naqarun mu cumapoh la.
micuwa’ su’ ka ini’ capoh?
naqarun mu cumapoh la.
maurag ku raralan, usaliy cumawm tikay.
S.TRANSL: 地板餐桌很髒，去擦一下。
The floor table is very dirty, go wipe it.

S.FORM: uwal, halay kuwing magal cu cacawm.
maurag cuqaang ku tuhung kahaca, usaliy cumawm tikay.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: ini’ na’, ini’ mu na’ naqariy cumapoh ku i runi.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw su’ i kisa’?
mausa’ kuwing kumiyum i papasibaq.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw su’ i muhngeq mateq?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: mausa’ kuwing gumluw cuku rawin mu i maquwas.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw niya’ i muhngeq matas?
mausa’ kuwing lumanguy mha.
S.TRANSL: He said he was going swimming.

S.FORM: kiya imu i Kiway quw?
kiya, patgiy imu ga.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: kiya imu i Lawa’ quw?
ukas wala, kiya a waw su’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 她不在耶，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here. What can I do for you?

S.FORM: i ima’?
utas, Tawyu’ kuwing, gawah cu balihun.
S.TRANSL: Grandfather, I am Tawyu', please open the door.

S.FORM: ima’ su’?
Bawtu’, Maya’ kuwing, muwah kuwing kumiyum isu’.
S.TRANSL: Bawtu', I'm Maya', I've come to see you.

S.FORM: ingasuw ta’ cubalay ini’ pakitaal la.
S.TRANSL: It's been a long time since we last met.

S.FORM: uwal wala! lungulungun mi su’ cubalay, nabibuwiy uwah ga, maskakaruay ta’.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!

S.FORM: tahunak, nubuwag cu cha han.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea first.

S.FORM: mahuway su’!
ca! nubuwag cu cha.
waw! balayq cubalay nubuwn ku cha mamu.
ca ga! maniqay ta’ cu uquuqu’.
uwal, talan ga kiiy cubalay balayq ku uquuqu’ ka hani.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: sahahiya’ niqun ku uquuqu’ quw?
uwal yu! sahahiya’ cubalay i niqun.
manaqru’ tumahuk cu kakagabiyan i yaya’ la, nabuwibuwiy uwah i maneq ga.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: uwal, mimaay kuwing cu qaba’ han.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: kakaya i maneq, baliy ta’ cuquleq.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

S.FORM: payux niqun mu la, matngi’ cubalay la.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: kapayux tikay maneq, laxi ku mubaga’.
uwal, sahahiya’ cubalay.
mausa’ kuwing la, wahay mi su’ mitaal lawwiy i babaw niya’.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: uwal, masugagayay ta’ la.
mahantan la, mausa’ kuwing imuwag la.
uwah lawwiy magunawu’ i babaw niya’ yu!
nahiyahiyaw i humakay.
uwal, kiya hreq na waw su’ ga uwah magunawu’ i imuwag mu.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: lawkah cimu kahabaag! rarasun cimu kisa’ ni papasibaq i tinqalangan na Itaal mitaal cu nanabakis na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: uwal! makalay cami cu kayi’ na Matu’uwal kinku nanabakis na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說汶水泰雅語。

S.FORM: sawbeh ta’ patayhuk la quw?
uwal ga, sawbeh ta’ patayhik la.
utas, muwah cami mitaal isu’ la!
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: waw! baaq cimu kumaal cu kayi’ na Matu’uwal! balayq cubalay!
S.TRANSL: 哇嗚！你們會說汶水泰雅啊!真是太棒了!
Wow! You would say Matuuwal! That’s great!

S.FORM: lawkah cimu kahabaag! rarasun cimu kisa’ ni papsibaq lumacu’ cu ki’man na turakis.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去拔除小米的雜草。
Hello everyone, today my teacher is going to take you to pull out the weeds of millet.

S.FORM: uwal, papasibaq.
uwah kahabaag tibalung i runi, laxi ungiiy maras ku paptawwa mamu.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: uwal, papasibaq, magal cami kahabaag cu papatawwaw la.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: tayhuk ta’ la quw?
ini’ na’, tatuhi’ na’.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: Pihaw, usa’ i puqusiya’ isu’ cu pahpah quw?
uwal, halay kuwing i puqusiya’.
usa’ magal isu’ ku aalawa’!
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: uwal, halay ci papagiyay cu kabahneq.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: lawkah cimu kahabaag! mausa’ ta’ i aangayan cu waqbux i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: yani wala! paphicuwa’ ta’ i musa’?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: gumalgay ta’ cu kulu’.
nababalayq i tibalung, pabaynay ta’ cu gagluw la.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票了。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: uwal!
puwg ga kakbahneq, quruquru’ ku tagi sug, guwagiy nanak cimu.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: papsibaq, maicu ci cu quru’.
hanuan ga, nanu’ usa’ umangay cu kakabahneq na isu’.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: qutux pincapngan cu wagi’ lga masautuay ta’ i runi lawwiy.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來這裡集合。
We’ll meet back here in an hour.

S.FORM: uwal, papsibaq, mahuway su’!
nanuwan ku talan su’ sawni?
payux cubalay ku kintalan mu ka quru’ ru balayq talan ka kakbahneq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多漂亮的鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes, and a lot of beautiful birds.

S.FORM: nabuwiybuwiy tikay, mausa’ ta’ la.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: ini’ na’, ma’uway a kukuy mu.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: magalgay ta’ musa’ i lumanguy quw?
uwal! tila ga!
habaag cubalay a itaal kiya lumanguy i runi.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: yayk a qusiya’ i tagi haca, asi ta’ languy i runi.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: humnicuwa’ si muwah?
huminakay cu.
gumiluw su’ kulu’ na nanuwan cu muwah?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: guminluw ci cu bas’ muwah.
humnicuwa’ si musa’ i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: rasun cu na kulu’ ni yaba’.
humicuwa’ musa’ papatiqan kariariax i hiya’?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: gumluw na ciyeyun musa’ papatiqan i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ musa’ mabaynay cu raramat i yaki’ su’?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: miray cu utubay musa’ mabaynay cu raramat i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: pahicuwa’ si musa’ i Lanyu?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: pagluw ci cu parnah musa’ i Lanyu.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: pahicuwa’ musa’ Lanyu i hiya’?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: pagluw na kulu’ na manbahaag musa’ Lanyu i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: guluw na nanuwan musa’ Kawsiyung i hiya?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: guminluw na kawtiye’ musa’ Kawsiyung i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: guminluw na kulu’ na hapuneq musa’ Taytung i hiya’ quw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: uwal, gumluw na kulu’ na hapuneq musa’ Taytung i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: guminluw na kulu’ na hapuneq musa’ Taytung i hiya’ quw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: iqaat, gumluw na kulu’ na manbahaag musa’ Taytung i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: kiya a nanaan cu bas’ tagi ruwni quw?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: kiya ga, usausa’ tiykay ru’ tatalan ku nanaan cu bas’ la.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ ku maksasawbeh i runi ka nanaan cu ciyeyun?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: ukas a ciyeyun i runi, paasiy su’ gluw cu takusi’ la.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: pakakituwa’ kiningasuw ga patayhuk i papatiqan?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: cakaan ru cakaan pincapngan cu wagi’ ga tayhuk i papatiqan.
gumluw cu kawtiye’ aring Taype’ ru Taycung ga kituwa’ pincapng cu wagi’ ga patayhuk?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵自臺北到臺中要多少時間？
How long does it take to take the THSR from Taipei to Taichung?

S.FORM: qutux pincapngan cu wagi’ ga tayhuk la i Taycung.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: muguaring Cirung miray cu kulu’ ga pakingasuw tayhuk i Ulay quw?
S.TRANSL: 從基隆開車去烏來要很久嗎?
Is it a long drive from Keelung to Wulai?

S.FORM: iy ukas a tumukyi’ i raraneq ga, patayhuk i qutux pincapng cu wagi’.
S.TRANSL: 如果路況順利的話，大約要一個小時可以抵達。
If the road condition is good, it will take about an hour to get there.

S.FORM: gumluw si cu ciyeyun muwah imuwag mu ga, pakingasuw quw?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要很久嗎?
Did it take you long to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: mausa’ cakaan pincapngan cu wagi’.
baaq si gumluw na tamayray quw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: baaq ci gumluw na tamayray.
kiya utubay su’ quw?
kiya qutux utubay mu.
kiya utubay su’ quw?
ukas a utubay mu.
pakbalayq mi su’ i paqucan quw?
balayq ga!
pakbalayq mi su’ i paqucan quw?
laxi, ini’ kapayux ku baqun mu.
S.TRANSL: Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: kiya hreq na waw si qaliyan quw? pakbalayq i wahan mi su’ maqut quw?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: uwal, nagaaw mi su’ imuwag.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: kiya a hreq na waw si casan quw? papaqut ci isu’ cu wawwaw na nanabakis na Itaal cuwnga’.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於泰雅族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legendary stories of the Atayal people.

S.FORM: mausa’ ci ragiyax casan, pakaukas ci imuwag yo!
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: isu’ ku paqucay ta’ mha cu gi’, pungan ku kayi ga, isu’ cubalay ku baaq cu wawwaw ru’ Gagagaga’ na nanabakis na Itaal cuwnga’.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對泰雅族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very knowledgeable about the traditional customs of the Atayal and would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: ini’ kapayux a baqun mu, asikinaga kiya ku baqun mu ga baliy ci palqing cumiyuk.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: pakbalayq i alan mu cu qalimu’ quw? nakiy ani kanuwan ga parhurhuw ca linanglung ku waw kahani.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: uwal, yani cubalay!
paya’ a kaal si la kahani?
maqisu’ kinamlapgan cu mamaspat kaal mu kahani la.
masilulux su’ cu lawkah su’ wala! ini’ patuqaqalinga’ a linanglung su’.
S.TRANSL: 98歲？您既長壽又健康呀!思維還這麼清楚。
98 also? You live a long and healthy life! You're still thinking clearly.

S.FORM: aqeh la! nabakis ci la cubalay.
minukahul si inu’?
minukahul ci Tabilas.
Itaal ku kanayril su’ uwiy quw?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是泰雅族人嗎?
Is your wife also an Atayal?

S.FORM: iqaat, Siputu’ na ihiya’.
baaq si kumaal cu kayi’ na nunuwan?
baaq ci kumaal cu kayi’ na Matu’uwal, Tu’ya’, Siputu’ ru’ baaq cu hayhayi’ cu kayi’ na Kamciyulang uwiy.
S.TRANSL: 我會說汶水泰雅語國語客語還略通閩南語。
I speak Brunei Atayal, Mandarin, Hakka and Minnan.

S.FORM: paqasun mu cubalay ku pinaskakaru’ mi ki isu’ sawni’, kalani tikay ku pisaneq na qaqaluwaap quw?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: uwal, mamati’ ci musa’ qumaluwaap i ragiyax cu mugumalak cu na’.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: mahuway su’! balayq cubalay ku pinasibaq su’ kuwing sawni’.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: cubalay ku pinqaqwu’ mu sawni ka sinbil na nanabakis.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: pasikiaw ti runi ku pinskakaru’ ta’, mahuway su’ cubalay ka sipasbabaq cami kahabaag.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: kaa ubaga’! maskakaruay ta’ babaw niya’ lawwiy.
mausa’ ci la, nagaaw mi muwng babaw niya’ lawwiy ku wawwaw na nanabakis cuwunga’ ka payux.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: uwal la! nahahiyaw i musa’ kiy! mapapugagagayay ta’ la!
S.TRANSL: Okay! Take care. See you later.

S.FORM: lawkah su’! nanuwan ku babinasun su’?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu tarunaw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: lawkah su’! pabaynay su’ cu nanuwan?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu qutux a qabubing.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu tarunaw, matbaynay cimu quw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: kiya ga, piya’ babinasn su’?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: matibaay cimu cu pinnong quw?
ukas, ini’ cami patibaay cu pinnong.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu buwax.
piya’ cu cabu’ ku babinasun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: ami cu tugal cabu’.
pabaynay ci cu bunga’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: giqarun i matbaynay ku bunga’ la.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: pabanay ci cu usayng tahusan papkarangi’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of cooking oil.

S.FORM: qutux nanak tahusan ku tha nha’ na bininasan.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: saani ci mabaynay cu batu’.
piya’ tintin ku babinasun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: piya’ tintin ku batu’ ka babinasun su’?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu usayng tintin.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu usayng bhul a nigi’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two onions.

S.FORM: tugal cu bhul nanak ku kiya la, biyanay mi su’ kahabaag la.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, you can have them all!

S.FORM: piya’ pila’ ku qutux cabu’ ka buwax kahani?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: usayng kabhul qutux cabu’.
mapusal cu quwn pila’ kahabaag, hanuan i mapusal pila’ la.
mahuway su’!
mamaqisu’ kinamlapgan cu imagal pila’ kahabaag i runi.
tuwangay mu tikay lawwiy, siqunaw ta’ cu kabhul pila’.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: imagal kabhul magalpuw pila’ kahabaag.
asi mu bayqiy cu imagal kabhul pila’ quw?
mamati’ cuqaang ku hani la, pakbalayq i mahnuk tikay quw?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: aqeh yo! anaga mahnuk cubalay ku hani lga.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: alaw mu ku pingkan kahani.
S.TRANSL: I want this bag of cookies.

S.FORM: matul pila’ ku pingkan kahani, paagal si cu ruma’ ka qaraqarax na’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
The cookies are $30, anything else you need?

S.FORM: pakbalayq ci kabawx cu pila’ ki isu’ quw?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: balayq ga, kituwa’ aalun su’?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: umungi’ ci maras cu pila’ la, pakbalayq ci kabawx cu pila’ ki isu’quw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ini’ cu aras cu pila’ wala!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: umungi’ ci maras cu pila’ la, pakbalayq ci kabawx cu pila’ ki isu’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: iys, ini’ su’ pasayugiy kuwing na’ ku kinabaxan ka pila’ cku yani.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: pakbalayq mu kabaxan ku situwing su’ quw?
uwal, agal nanak.
pakbalayq mi kabaxan ku ruwas su’ quw?
sipakabawx mi Yuraw la.
kabaxay ta’ ku tamayray su’ quw?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: uwal, asikinaga satu’ lawwiy i casan ke!
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: qumuwalax la, ini’ cu aras cu hawsuwa, kabaxay ta’ cu hawsuwa han quw?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: qutux nanak ku hawswa mu, taumukay ta’ kawsa’.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: yani ku pinkabawx si kuwing cuku yani ku ruwas kahani, biqanay mi isu’ la.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku ruwas ka tatalun su’ na’, kalani kuwing.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: papsayugan mi su’ kanuwan cu pila’?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: hanuan, kiya a pila’ su’ lga kaal la.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: papsayugan si kanuwan ku pila mu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: pasayugay mi su’ i casan.
S.TRANSL: I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: papsayugan si kanuwan ku ruwas mu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: aquw mi su’ sipasayu cuhisa’ la!
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: pinkabawx su’ ni Yukeq ku papateq ka haniy quw?
S.TRANSL: Did Yukeh lend you this pen?

S.FORM: uwal, kinabaxan mu ki hiya’ sawni’.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: kinabaxan su’ ki Yukeh ku papateq ka hani quw?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Yukeh?

S.FORM: iqaat, binaynay ni yaya’ ku hani.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: ukas a timu’ la, usa’ kabawx cu timu’ ki Yuma’.
S.TRANSL: 沒有鹽了，去跟Yuma’ 借點鹽。
We're out of salt, go borrow some from Yuma'.

S.FORM: uwal, halay ci kabawx.
usa’ kumaal Tiwas maha pasayugi ku pila mu.
S.TRANSL: Go and ask Tiwas to return my money.

S.FORM: piya’ pila’ ku kusa’ niya’ ki isu’?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: mausa’ si inu’?
mausa’ ci paparuxaw mumuwa’ cu paruxaw.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw su’?
sumiliyat ci cu ki’man ka kehma cuqaang, papqusiyaan mi kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: papa’uwah ku sasiliyat kikuw kawsu’ han quw?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: sukuun si inu’?
kiya cku beeh na kakalu’.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: tinabul si la quw?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: yani mu na’ tinabul, gagahapan mi kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: pakbalayq i hibagun ku pinumuwa’ su’ ka paruxaw la quw?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: balayq hibagun la ku tamana’ ka hani, tikuw sina’ tigi haca ga aqeh kikun na’.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: apaaw! kinapayux kinayi’ su’ ka bunga’.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: anlu’ani ci sumirhuw i tawbuw han quw?
S.TRANSL: Will you collect it for me?

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw mamu?
kiya cami umayng cu quleh.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: payux quleh i runi quw?
makasiun ca wawwaw’ a qinleh la.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ si qumleq kariariax?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: buun mu na tipanaq.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: baaq si cumbu’ na buhinuw cu qbuqbux quw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: alun mu na talnga’, takikul, wahiy… ku qbuqbux, mahananu’ ga maras ci cu xuwil ru patus i qumaluwaap.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: tuqiy na bawwak ku hani.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: micuwa’ su’ ka baqun?
ra’ru’ na bawwak ku hani, kahi’ tuqiy na bawwak san ku hani.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: nabuwiybuwiy musa’ gumawwag ku wahiy ta’, asiga tiruweq la.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: micuwa’ su’ ka baqun pisa?
sawkan na xuwil la, nabubuwisay ti gumluw.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku kiya si kabalayun?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: rangay ku hani, a’pux cu qawlit.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku sukuun su’ ka haca?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: wahi ku haca, tatiruweq niyam cu para’.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: mahuway cubalay ku Utux na nanabakis, payux cubalay ku qbuqbux ka inagal niyam sawni’.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: uwal wala! rasaw ti tinqalangan manbabalayq i qumasu maneq.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: pasibaqay cimu ni papsibaq kisa’ cu hacuwalun kumaal na kayi’ na Matu’uwal ku qaqasinu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教你們動物的汶水泰雅語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Matuuwal language today.

S.FORM: pasibaqay cimu ni papsibaq kisa’ cu hacuwalun kumaal na kayi’ na Matu’uwal ku kakahuneq.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教你們植物的汶水泰雅語怎麼說。

S.FORM: pasibaqay cimu ni papsibaq kisa’ cu nanuwan san na Matu’uwal ku uquuqu’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教你們水果的汶水泰雅語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Matuuwal language today.

S.FORM: laxi ku tumubun.
laxi ku sangaquwaq.
laxi ku maneq cu nananiqun.
agal ku ruwas su’.
agal ku papatas su’.
papa’uwah ku pinatas su’.
sirhu ku ruwas.
sirhu ku papatas
sirhu ku naniqun.
sirhu ku papganawun.
ima’ papatas ku hani?
yani ku ikuwing.
ima’ ruwas ku hani?
yani ku Lawsing.
ima’ papawng cu pinatas ku hani?
ini’ mu baqi.
siyatu’ ni Tayax ku haca qu?
iqaat, ciyak ni Maya’ ku hani.
papsibaq, ini’ kuwing aras cu ruwas.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: paglu mitaal kinku tagi kiyl su’.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: mapuhu ku papatas mu la.
kabawx ki baays su’ matas.
nanu’ patasi na papatas la !
magaang ku papawng cu pinatas mu la.
kabaxanay mu isu’ ku papawng cu pinatas mu.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: paalax ta’ matas la, panabaq i raan musa’ imu.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心。
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: uwal, mahuway su’! papsibaq.
paalax ta’ matas la, mapapugagayay ta’ kahabaag!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: mapugagayay ta’ la papsibaq!
lawkah ta’ kahabaag! ralu’ mu ga Buyung.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Buyung.

S.FORM: Buyung, lawkah su’!
lawkah ta’ kahabaag! ralu’ mu ga Takun.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Takun.

S.FORM: Takun , lawkah su’!
lawkah su’! ikuwing ga Buyung.
Buyung lawkah su’! ikuwing ga Ingaw.
lawkah su’! ikuwing ga Takun.
Takun lawkah su’! ikuwing ga Ingaw.
ima’ su’?
ikuwing ga yaya’ ni Iban, ikuwing ga Tawyu’.
ima’ su’?
ikuwing ga suwayi’ na kanayril ni Iban, ralu’ mu ga Ali’.
S.TRANSL: 我是Kaynu’的妹妹，我的名字是Ali’。
I am Kaynu’s sister. My name is Ali’.

S.FORM: ima’ i hiya’?
hiya’ ga sinsi’ mu, ralu’ niya’ ga Hayung.
ima’ ku itaal ka haca?
hiya’ ga qumisuwan mu na mamaliku, ralu’ niya’ ga Qumaw.
hiya’ ga Buyung qu?
uwal, hiya’ ga Buyung.
isu’ ga Buyung qu?
iqaat, ikuwing ga Ingaw.
ima’ ku Buyung?
ikuwing ku Buyung.
ima’ ku Ingaw?
Ingaw ga rawin mu.
nanuwan ku ralu’ ni qumisuwan na kanayril su’?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: ralu’ ni qumisuwan na kanayril mu ga Amuy.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Amuy.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku ralu’ ni suwayi’ na kanayril su’?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: ralu’ ni suwayi’ na kanayril mu ga Tapas.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Tapas.

S.FORM: baqun su’ ku ralu’ niya’ qu?
ralu’ niya’ ga Buyung.
piya’ kaal ni qumisuwan na mamaliku su’ kaal ka hani la?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: magalpu cu imagal kaal niya’ ka hani la.
piya’ kaal ni suwayi’ na mamaliku su’ kaal ka hani la?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: imagal kaal niya’ ka hani la.
kiya papatasan i tinqalangan mamu qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: kiya.
kiya su’ matas i papatasan na tinqalangan qu?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: uwal ga, asi cami ga qutux cu imu i matas papatasan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: ima’ ku mamaliku ka haca?
hiya’ ga mama’ mu.
ima’ ku kanayril ka haca?
hiya’ ga qumisuwan na kanayril mu.
ima’ ku ulaqi’ ka haca?
hiya’ ga suwayi’ na mamaliku mu.
nanuwan ku patuwawun ni yaya’ su’?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: hiya’ ga hitay.
nanuwan ku patuwawun ni yaba’ su’?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: hiya’ ga papsibaq.
hiya’ ga suwayi’ na mamaliku su’ qu?
iqaat, hiya’ ga rawin ni suwayi’ na mamaliku mu.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: hiya’ ga qumisuwan na kanayril su’ qu?
iqaat, hiya’ ga suwayi’ na kanayril mu.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: papiya’ kahabaag ku qutux naha’ cu imu?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: imagal kahabaag ku qutux naha’ cu imu.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: papiya’ ku ulaqi’ imu mamu?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: sapaat kahabaag ku ulaqi’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: papiya’ ku suwayi’ na mamaliku ru suwayi’ na kanayril su’?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ukas suwayi’ na mamaliku mu, tugal ku suwayi’ na kanayril mu.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: papiya’ ku yulah ru iyah su’?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ukas a yulah ru iyah mu.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: papiya’ ku matasasuwayi’ na mamaliku ru kanaril su’?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ukas a matasasuwayi’ na mamaliku ru kanayril mu.
matasasuwayi’ cimu qu?
uwal, hiya’ ga yulah mu.
Itaal cimu qu?
uwal, Itaal cami.
hiya’ ga Itaal uwi qu?
uwal ga, hiya’ ga Itaal uwi.
humicuwa’ ku kaal sawni’?
gihaaq tikay ku kaal, kapayux manubuwag cu qusiya’ ka makilux.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku kaal sawni’?
makilux tikay ku kaal, kapayux manubuwag cu qusiya’.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku kaal i lata’?
rahwal a wagi’, laxi ku umungi’ maras cu tataumuk.
S.TRANSL: 太陽很大，要記得防曬用具。
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku kaal i lata’?
payux hamhum, ukas wagi’ i kaal.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: paphicuwa’ ku kaal i casan?
pakaukas wagi’ i casan, payux hamhum, rahuwal bayhu.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku kaal cuku riax ka yani?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: gihaaq tikay kaal cuku riax ka hani, pasiyatu’ cu siyatu’ ka kehma i mausa’ lata’.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿厚衣服。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: paphicuwa’ ku kaal i riax hahangiqan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: pakbalayq ku kaal i riax hahangiqan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: paquwalax i riax ka yani qu?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: pakbalayq ku kaal cku riax ka yani, iqaat paquwalax.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: paquwalax a kaal cku riax ka yani qu?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: uwal, paquwalax cuku riax ka yani.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: qumuwalax kahani qu?
masuwat la, pakahtu a wagi’ la.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: qumuwalax kahani qu?
qumuwalax la, ini’ kuwing aras cu hawsuwa.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: qumuwalax i lata’ qu?
ini’ quwalax kahani, paquwalax i minaneq qaliyan, aras cu hawsuwa i patgi lata’.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: pakgihaaq i qamisan pilag a kaal qu?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: uwal, paktala’tu’ i kaal pilag, kapayux masiyatu’.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: pakakilux i gabagan kaal kahani qu?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: uwal, pakakilux cubalay i gabagan, kapayux manubuwag cu qusiya’.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: balayq su’ ku gabagan ka tikay qu?
balayq mu cubalay i gabagan ka tikay, halhul a kaal.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: balayq su’ ku qamisan ka tikay qu?
aqeh mu ku qamisan ka tikay, puyux a mamati’ ka bayhu.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: umungi’ kuwing maras cu ruwas la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: magalgay kuwing mitaal ki isu’.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: umungi’ kuwing maras cu papawng cu pinatas la.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: kabaxanay mu isu’.
umungi’ su’ maras cu papatas la qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: uwal, kabaxay mu ku papatas su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: nanuwan ku naniqun su’ i kumuriax?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: paqaneq kuwing cu miyenpaw.
nanuwan ku naniqun su’ i kumugabiyan?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: paqaneq kuwing cu mami’.
nanuwan ku niqun su’ cu kumunama’?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: minaneq kuwing cu batu’.
nanuwan ku niqun su’ cu kumuriax?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: minaneq kuwing cu hyi’ na waylung.
halay ta’ i kumcacri’ cu mari’.
usausa’ isu’ han, usalay mi su’ kumiyum i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: halay ta’ i lumanguy.
uwal! magalgay ta’ i musa’.
halay ta’ i magunawu’ cu mari’.
laxi, halay ta’ i humakut cu ruwas han.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: quminuwax su’ cu gi’nux la qu?
iqaat na’, kiya kuwing qumuwax cu salaman.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: quminuwax su’ cu ngaquwaq la qu?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: quminuwax kuwing cu ngaquwaq la.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: quminuwax su’ cu salaman la qu?
naqarun mu qumuwax ku salaman la.
micuwa’ su’ ka ini’ payma’ cu qaba’?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: mimaay kuwing kisa’.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw su’ sawni’?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: minusa’ kuwing kumiyum i papsibaq.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku pakawaw su’ i malax matas?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: papasauhi kuwing i imu.
nanuwan ku pakawaw niya’ i malax matas?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: mausa’ hiya’ i yugi’.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Ali’, kiya su’ i imuwag qu?
kiya, nabuwibuwi patgi imu.
Ali’, kiya su’ i imuwag qu?
ukas imu i Ali’, Iwal kuwing, kiya a waw qu? muwah i Ali’ ga panqaquanay mu.
S.TRANSL: Ali’不在家耶，我是Iwal，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Ali’。
Ali’ is not at home. I am Iwal. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: ima’ cimu?
aki’, Amuy ru Ali’ cami, gawahani cami cu balihun.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Amuy 和 Ali’，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Amuy and Ali’, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: ima’?
Buya’ kuwing, muwah kuwing kumiyum i Yupas.
S.TRANSL: I am Buya’, I am here for Yupas.

S.FORM: aki’, muwah kuwing mitaal isu’ la.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: ingasu su’ cubalay ini’ uwah la, lungulungun mi su’ cubalay.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Ali’, muwah kuwing kumiyum isu’ magunawu’ la.
S.TRANSL: Ali, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: nabuwibuwi patgi imuwag, ingasu mi su’ nagaun la.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: pinumuwa’ mu ku bunga’ kahani, qaneq cu mama’!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: lalbing cubalay ku bunga’ kahani.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: ibuwi! pinumuwa’ mu ku uquuqu’ kahani, qaneq cu mama’.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: lalbing cubalay ku uquuqu’ kahani.
tahunak! pinumuwa’ mu ku qatiyay kahani, qaneq cu mama’.
S.TRANSL: 請坐!這是我種的有機玉米吃看看。
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: waw! lalbing cubalay ku qatiyay kahani.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: paqaneq su’ cu iyuk qu?
aqeh kuwing maneq cu iyuk, maniqay kuwing cu pingkwo’.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: paqaneq su’ cu pingkan qu.
uwal, balayq mu.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: tagaqanay mi su’ cu uquuqu’.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: mahuway su’! payux cubalay a booq naku uquuqu’ kahani.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: alanay mi su’ cu qusiya’.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: mahuway su’!
kapayux i maneq, payux tinahuk mu ka raramat.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: waw! sahahiya’ sawkan ru sahahiya’ cubalay uwi i niqun.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: kapayux i maneq, payux na’ i runi.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: iqaat kuwing paubaga’ la yo!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: kapayux i maneq, payux na’ i runi.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: payux cubalay niqun mu la, iqaat mausa’ i niqun laa.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: rarasun cimu ni papsibaq i ragiyax kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: payux kuwi’ i ragiyax mha i yaya’.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: rarasun cimu ni papsibaq i claq kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ i maxmux cu rawq qu?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ inu’ i kisa’?
rarasun ta’ ni papsibaq i siyag na luliyung.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ inu’ i kisa’?
rarasun ta’ i ragiyax ni papsibaq.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ i siyag na luliyung i kisa’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: iqaat, rarasun ta’ i ragiyax ni papsibaq.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ i ragiyax i kisa’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: iqaat, mausa’ ta’ i claq i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: papsibaq, nanuwan ku tatalun ta’ i siyag na luliyung?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ umangay cu qaqlayngan.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: papsibaq, nanuwan ku tatalun ta’ i ragiyax?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ umangay cu tatayu’.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku usalan ta’ i claq?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ i claq mitaal cku pinumuwa’ ta’ ka qatiyay, panabaq kiya a qatahi’, buwayng yo!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: papsibaq, mausa’ ta’ lumanguy i luliyung qu?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: iqaat, mausa’ ta’ umangay cu qaqlayngan.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: papsibaq, mausa’ ta’ mumuwa’ cu paparuxaw i claq qu?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: mausa’ ta’ i gumaxbux cu rawq i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: kiya a qaqlayngan i haca ka manbahaag tagi runi manbahaag tagi haca.
yani kuiwng na’ mitaal cu maqiyanux cubalay ka qaqlayngan.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: kiya a tatayu’ i haca ka manbahaag tagi runi manbahaag tagi haca.
ye! wa! balayq mu tatayu’, magbatunux cubalay.
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: kiya a tatayu’ i haca ka manbahaag tagi runi manbahaag tagi haca.
iqaat tatayu’ ku haca, haca ga tatina’ na buwayng.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: asi angay i runi, laxi ku musa’ tatuhi’ cuqaang yo!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: uwal, qaat cami mausa’ tatuhi’ cuqaang.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: laxi ku maktaliyum, anahiyahiyaw i humakay naki ini’ kataku.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: maki nabuwibuwisun mu i talan.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: huminicuwa’ su’ musa’ i tatak?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: miniray kuwing cu kulu’ musa’ i tatak.
huminicuwa’ hiya’ musa’ i papkitalan cu kinmuxaal?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: huminakay hiya’ musa’ i papkitalan cu kinmawxa’.
huminicuwa’ su’ musa’ i Pnghu’?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: guminlu kuwing na kulu’ ka manbahaag musa’ i Pnghu’.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: huminicuwa’ su’ musa’ i Pnghu’?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: guminlu kuwing na parnah musa’ i Pnghu’.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: guminlu su’ na nanuwan cu muwah i imuwag?
guminlu kuwing na cieyun cu muwah i imu.
guminlu na nanuwan i Pukaw cu musa’ i papatiqan?
S.TRANSL: How does Pukaw go to school?

S.FORM: guminlu na kulu’ na hapuy i Pukaw cu musa’ i papatasan.
S.TRANSL: Pukaw goes to school by train.

S.FORM: gumilu na nanuwan i Kaynu’ cu musa’ i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: How does Kaynu go to church?

S.FORM: guminlu na tamayray i Kaynu’ cu musa’ i kiyukay.
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’ goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: gumlu su’ na cieyun musa’ i mateq qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: iqaat, gumlu kuwing na bas’ musa’ i matas.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: gumlu su’ na tamayray musa’ i mateq qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: uwal, gumlu kuwing na tamayray musa’ i matas.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: gumlu su’ na kawte’ musa’ i Kawsyung qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: uwal, gumlu kuwing na kawte’ musa’ i Kawsyung.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: gumlu su’ na kulu’ na hapuneq quga kulu’ ka manbahaag musa’ i Taytung?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: gumlu kuwing na kulu’ na manbahaag, ini’ kanga’ tayhuk nku gumlu cu kulu’ na manbahaag ku gumlu cu kulu’ na hapuy.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: gumlu su’ na bas’ quga miray cu kulu’ musa’ i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: miray kuwing na kulu’ musa’ i kiyukay, masiuhiuhi nku gumlu na bas’ ku miray nanak cu kulu’.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: makasasawbeh imuwag mamu ku babinasan cu aninanuwan qu?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ini’ pakasasawbeh, gumlu kuwing na utubay musa’ i babinasan cu aninanuwan.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: makasasawbeh i papatiqan ku yucyu’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: sawbeh, tehkan i humakay.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: makasasawbeh i autuan cu kulu’ ku naniqan qu?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: matgi lata’ na autuan cu kulu’ ru’ humakay cu mamagalpu cu qayaw ga tayhuk la.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走幾十步路就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: kiya a hreq na waw si kisa’ qu?
micuwa’ la?
mikiusalan mi su’ mitaal.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: kiya a waw mu kisa’, iqaat cu pakakiya imu, iyug ku riax qu!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧！
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: pakakiya a hreq na waw si casan qu? wahay mi su’ kumiyum i minaneq qaliyan.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: uwal, nagaaw mi su’ imu.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: pakbalayq ci magal cu kayi’ qu? papateq mu.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: uwal ga! cungus niya’.
pakbalayq i magal cu qalimu’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: laxi gii! aqeh ci talan, ini’ kagawi uwi ku qabqub.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看！倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: nanu’ asi ci agal cu qalimu’.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: laxi uwi ku magal cu qalimu’.
mahuway su’ ka siwalan si kuwing i maskakaru’ ru mapaqut.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: cungus niya’, nanuwan ku papaqut su’?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: paqucay mi su’ han, nanuwan ku waw si cu ulaqi’ su’?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: mintga kinsat kuwing cunga’, ga malax ci la kahani.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: kiya a waw su’ kahani qu?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: kiya ci matawwaw i papatasan.
kiya i tinqalangan ragiyax uwi ku ulaqi’ su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ukas, kiya i qalang quwis ku ulaqi’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: isu’ nanak ku kiya i runi qu?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: suman ci cu qutux xuwil ru qutux a kabahneq, qutux mu cu imu uwi nha’.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: qutux ku ngiyaw ka saanan mu uwi, sumbabaas ikuwing, naki ti ini’ ka sapeeq mha cu.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，陪伴我，我想才不令我無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: paqucay mi su’ tikay cku Gaga’ ka papisaneq i qumaluwaap.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ini’ kapayux a baqun mu, gi’ ini’ papbiingi cu wawwaw na qaqalup na mamaliku ku kaknayril, ga’ kiya ku baqun mu ga kalanay isu’ kahabaag.
S.TRANSL: 由於禁忌婦女碰觸男人狩獵的器具，因此我知道的不多，但我了解的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: kiya a Gaga’ mamu ka papisaneq na qaraqarax na qaqaluwaap qu?
S.TRANSL: Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: ini’ papbingiani cku kaknayril ku wawwaw na qaqalup na mamaliku.
S.TRANSL: 男士的獵具是不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: pakbalayq maglu musa’ i qumaluwaap ku kanayril qu?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: aqeq cubalay! paysan gumlu musa’ qumalup ku kanayril uwi.
S.TRANSL: 萬萬不行！女人跟著去打獵也是禁忌。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Kaynu’, ukas a quwaw i imu la, usa’ mabaynay isu’ han.
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’，家裡沒有酒了，你先去買。
Kaynu, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: kiya na’ qutux tahusan i gaghapuyan, hanuan ini’ baynay la!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: iqaat pakacka’ i qutux tahusan, usa’ mabaynay lawwi cu usayng tahusan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: pabaynay ci cu quwaw, matibaynay cimu qu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: kiya ga, piya’ a babinasun su’?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: pabaynay kuwing cu usayng tahusan ru qutux cabu’ a buwax.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: kiya runi ku buwax, nanuwan ku aalun su’ na’?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: pabaynay kuwing uwi cu batu’, kiya qu?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: naqarun matibaynay ku batu’ niyam la.
pabaynay kuwing cu situwing.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ ku su’uwaan su’?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: pabaynay kuwing cku isting a uyit ka situwing.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: micuwa’ ku matanah kahani?
kiya ruma’ ka iru’ qu?
kiya na’ a mauba’ kinku mawaseq.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: alani kuwing ku mataseq kahaca.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Kaynu’, minusa’ si inu’ sawni’ la? minusa’ si maktaliyum qu?
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’ 你剛剛去哪裡了? 你去運動嗎?
Kaynu’, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: iqaat, minusa’ ci rumag yaki’ matibaynay cu raramat.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: aqu muwani, kiya a hreq na waw si gabiyan qu? papaglu si maneq ki kuwing qu?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: aqeh, mausa’ ci mabaynay cu situwing.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: nanu’ gumalgay ci isu’ musa’.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: lawkah su’! piya’ pila’ qutux cu bhul ku paruxaw kahani?
S.TRANSL: 你好！請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: mapusal pila’ qutux cu bhul.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: piya’ pila’ ku bunga’ kahani?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: matul pila’ qutux tintin.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: mabinasay ci cu usayng bhul paruxaw ru qutux tintin a bunga’.
S.TRANSL: 我買兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Kaynu’, umungi ci maras cu papatas la, pakbalayq si sipkabawx ikuwing ku isu’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’，我忘了帶筆，你的可以借我嗎?
Kaynu’, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ukas a ikuwing uwi, yani ku Pukaw ku hani.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Pukaw’s.

S.FORM: nanu’ pakbalayq i sipkabawx kuwing cu pilapilag qu? nabuwibiwisaw mi pasayu isu’.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: uwal, agal ga.
mahuway su’, mahuway su’ kusa i Pukaw uwi.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Pukaw for me.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku aalun?
papasayu ci cku usayng ka ruwas kahani.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: uwal, paagal si cu nanuwan na’ qu?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: pakabawx ci na’ cu tugal ka ruwas kahani.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: uwal, kaa ungii pa’buwinah i makatuu’.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: ini’ su’ pa’buwinahi kuwing na’ ku papawng cu pinateq.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: sipa’buwinah mu cuhisa’ la.
micuwa’ ka magaang lku papawng cu pinateq mi la?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: ini’ su’ ka sipkabawx i Kaynu’ lga.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Kaynu’?

S.FORM: ini’ mu baqi, halay mi maqut hiya’.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: pakbaxanay mi su’ ku papawng cu pinatas mu han.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Pukaw, pinkabawx isu’ ni Kaynu’ ku situwing ka kehma kahani qu?
S.TRANSL: Pukaw，這個外套是 Kaynu’ 借你的嗎?
Pukaw, did Kaynu’ lend you this coat?

S.FORM: iqaat, binaynay ikuwing ni yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: macka’ kinku isu’ ku situwing ka kehma ni Kaynu’.
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’ 的外套跟你的一樣。
Kaynu’’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: magauu’ ku siyatu’ niya’ ka kehma, ini’ packa’ iru’ kinku ita’.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Pukaw, kumnabawx si cu pila’ ki Kaynu’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Pukaw, did you borrow money from Kaynu’?

S.FORM: uwal, naki mi pinsayugan hiya’ sawni’, umungi ci maras cu pila’ la.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: nanu’ papsayugan si kanuwan?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: pasiyugay mi hiya’ i casan.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: uwal, kalanay mi su’ i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Kaynu’ for you.

S.FORM: asiki rangayun ku qawlit, alun na tuquwaq quga rapal a tikuxi’.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸或套腳式陷阱抓這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: aqu muwani, nauquun mi la, kahi’ ini’ cu tiruweq.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了，難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: nanu’ pasibaqay mi su’ sumku’.
S.TRANSL: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: yani cubalay gii! naki ci magal tikay.
S.TRANSL: 太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: kehma cuqaang ku ki’man i claq la, usali magal i tatak ku sasiliyat, halay ti claq.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太茂盛了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: kiya sukuun inu’ ku sasiliyat?
kiya kiyl na kagisi’, usa’ i tatak ru tatalun si la.
S.TRANSL: 在背簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: panabaq i magal, ngawsun cubalay ku sasiliyat.
S.TRANSL: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: pehlay su’ ku wahi mu!
kiya inu’ ku sinku’ su’?
kiya cku yahu’ na kahuneq kahaca ku wahi mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: micuwa’ su’ ka ini’ ungii?
kiya mi turingan.
kawbu’ ku hani, sukuun niyam i gawng.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: ukas a kawbu’ niyam, asi cami panayp.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣的。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: qaat kuwing pinanayp na’, pasibaqi kuwing babaw niya’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有釣過魚，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: uwal! magalgay ti babaw niya’ musa’ panayp.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: nanu’ pasibaqay mi su’ kabalay cu kawbu’ i babaw niya’.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: mawiwi’ ku babaan si la, ini’ ka kumat a quleh lga? nabuwibuwi i pasiklu ga.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了？你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: nuhanhan, manlaglag a qasu la. huluyaw mi runi ku babaan, usa’ tagi haca magal cu kari’.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: huluy tagi kuwing runi ku quleh, ragay mi su’ humuluy.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: wa! balayq cubalay inuwah ta’ sawni’, makasiun a wawa’ la.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: halay ti qumasu kahabaag.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: awni i papsibaq la.
laxi ku maganawu’ la, nabuwibuwi i matahunak i tatahunakan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: apaw wala! hanuan kiy! sumiyahoq kuwing la!
nabuwibuwi i patagi papatiqan.
papatuwawan tagi piya’ i sawni’?
papatuwawan tagi imagal sawni’, pauhngeq i casan, magalgay ta’ i musa’ maganawu’ ga!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: uwal! halay ta’ i siyag na luliyung.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: papatuwawan tagi piya’ i casan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: papatuwawan tagi tugal i casan, mausa’ ta’ i maganawu’ cu mari’ i kuminuriax casan ga!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: nanuwan ku waw su’ i kasasanan casan?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: a’hahangiqan i casan, mausa’ kuwing ki yaya’ i kiyukay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: humicuwa’ su’ la?
mikimutaq kuwing, mausa’ kuwing i papasqutian.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: matukayran a tunux mu.
pataqawmug i mungeq isu’.
papsibaq, muxaal a nabuwas mu, mausa’ kuwing i papasqutian.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: uwal, nabuwibuwi tikay i musa’.
pakabalayq kuwing i musa’ i mayma’ cu qaba’ qu?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: sawbeh pauhngeq i mateq la, usa’ i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: papsibaq, muxaal a tunux mu, pauhngeq kuwing i kuminuriax.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: uwal, panabaq i musa’ imuwag.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: papsibaq, pauhngeq kuwing i babaw na a’hahangiqan i paptuwawan tagi qutux, mausa’ kuwing i pakitaal cu kuwisang.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: uwal, nabalayq i malahang ku hihihi’.
kiya inu’ i Bagan?
muxaal a nabuwas niya’, kiya i papasqutian.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ i Atung?
papsibaq, muxaal a waqcug ni Atung muhngeq sawni’.
S.TRANSL: 老師，Atung 喉嚨痛，今天請假。
Teacher, Atung has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: micuwa’ ka ini’ uwah i Haking?
makilux i hiya’ la.
panqaquanay mu ikuwing nanak.
ralu’ mu ga Baay na Payan, magalpu a kaal mu ka hani.
S.TRANSL: 我叫 Baay na Payan，我今年10歲。
My name is Baay na Payan, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: nanuwan ku ralu’ su’?
Baay na Payan ku ralu’ mu.
S.TRANSL: My name is Baay na Payan.

S.FORM: ulaqi’ su’ na Itaal na nanuwan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: ulaqi’ kuwing na Itaal.
Itaal kahabaag ku itaal i imuwag su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: uwal ga, Itaal cami kahabaag ka qutux cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是泰雅族人。
Yes, my whole family is Atayal.

S.FORM: Itaal kahabaag ku itaal i imuwag su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: iqaat, Itaal i yaba’ mu, Tu’iya’ i yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是泰雅族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Atayal, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: ulaqi’ su’ ni ima’?
ulaqi’ kuwing ni Payan na Buyung.
S.TRANSL: 我是 Payan na Buyung 的小孩。
I am Payan na Buyung’s child.

S.FORM: haca ku yaba’ su’ qu? piya’ a kaal niya’ la?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: mamatuu’ kinamlapgan a kaal niya’ la.
haca ku yaba’ su’ qu? piya’ a kaal niya’ la?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: iqaat, nabakis na tinqalangan niyam i hiya’, mamaspat kinamlapgan a kaal niya’ la.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: piya’ a kaal ni qumisuwan na mamaliku su’ la?
magalpu cu mamaspat kaal ni qumisuwan na mamaliku mu la.
payux a kaal kin rahuwal ni isu’ i qumisuwan na mamaliku su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: imagal cu kaal a inuwaw niyam.
piya’ ku kin ibabawiqan su’?
kabhul cu masupatul kungfn ku kin ibabaweq mu.
ingasug ta’ ini’ pakitaal la, ini’ su’ ka manrakiyas laga?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: uwal ga, kabhul cu matuul kungfn kuwing la.
ini’ su’ ka kithu laga?
ini’, tumnauqu su’ i mitaal la.
mahikang su’ la qu?
ini’, kithu kuwing la.
kithu su’ la qu?
uwal, matuul tintin kuwing ka hani la.
mausa’ su’ i inu’?
mausa’ kuwing i pankungs’ kumiyum i papsibaq.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: mausa’ inu’ i Kawyay?
mausa’ pakati’ cu siyup i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ i Hawan?
kiya i lalanguyan i hiya’, mausa’ i macacpung lumanguy kisa’ i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ i Binay? pacacpung maktaliyum kisa’ i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Binay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Binay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: kiya i litang i hiya’, halay mu i humuwaw i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: magalgay ta’ musa’ i paptaliyuman ga!
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: halay kuwing i mabaynay cu kakriaxan han, kiyumaw mi su’ i kisa’.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: magalgay ta’ musa’ i rumileq cu sibileq ga!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kiyum cuquleq isu’, mausa’ kuwing i kumiyum i papsibaq.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Lawsing pacacpung su’ tumuting cu mari’ i kisa’ qu?
S.TRANSL: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: iqaat, pacacpung cu mastatayl i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyum ga mausa’ su’ i macacpung qu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uwal ga, pacacpung kuwing cu maktaliyum.
riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyum ga mausa’ su’ i macacpung qu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: pacacpung kuwing tumuting cu mari’.
riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyum ga nanuwan ku pakawaw ta’?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: papacpung ta’ i mahahuluy cu siniyug.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: riax ka pacacpngan i maktaliyum ga nanuwan ku nananiqun ka paptibinasun ta’?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: iqaat, patibaynay ta’ cu kikuy.
magal su’ cu capaang tagi magalayng, lawkah su’ cubalabalay!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: mahuway su’!
kiya i imug i yaki’ qu?
kiya, kiya i maqilaap i qaqlapan i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: kiya i imug i yaki’ qu?
ukas, yani na’ matgi latanux la, asiki gabiyan ga ma’uwah imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: kiya i imug i yutas qu?
kiya i masnapusal tinantun na imuwag, usa’ kumiyum i riyatux isu’.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: kiya a itaal imug qu?
aqu i Kagi’! ingasug su’ cubalay ini’ tali la, lawkah su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 是Kagi' 啊，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Kagi’. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: balayq ga! wahan mi su’ i kumiyum maskakaru’.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: kiya inu’ i yaba’ su’?
kiya i gaghapuyan humalngag cu raramat, halay mi kumaal i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: aruwa inu’ i Bagan la?
aruwa i libu’ na waylung rumakaap cu waylung i hiya’.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: utas, awni cami la.
ukas imuwag i yutas mamu, kiya i claq i hiya’, naga’ imuwag cimu i hiya’ han.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: mama’, uniyal su’ uwi la!
ingasug ta’ cubalay ini’ pakitaal la, ibabaweq su’ la yo!
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: paqasun mu cubalay kinitaal isu’.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: binayq icimu ku pangran ka hani, asiki sukuun i pingsiyang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: ingasug ini’ uwah la, kurunguun mi cimu kahabaag i maneq.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: hanuan ga, hanuan kuwing asi nubuwag cu cha, maskakaruay ta’ i papaskakaruan.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: mausa’ kuwing i imug la, mahuway cubalay ku ginalayng su’!
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: yani na’ tinuting ku waylung ka hani, aras isu’ imuwag tihiyahiyaw i maneq.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: pakbalayq ti makitaal i kumnuriax casan qu?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: balayq ga, papkitaal ti inu’?
makitalay ti papatasan qu? paagal cami cu qalimu’.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: nanu’ halay ti papasutuan ga, papsituwing ci cu situwing na Itaal i musa’.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: kehma i makpahpah ku qaym na kabahneq i tinqalangan niyam ga balayq cubaly i talan, iy makpahpah lga wahi ci kumiyum ga!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: aqu asiki nagaun ruu’ gabagan ka tikay, ingasug cuqaang lqu!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: nanu’ uwah i tatubunan cu kinloh la!
S.TRANSL: 那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: uwal la! paqasaw mi numaga’!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: micuwa’ su’ ka mabuwinah lawwi maqiyanux i tinqalangan?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: mausa’ ci pasibaq cu ruwas.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: micuwa’ ka ini’ kakiya i tinqalangan quwis pasibaq cu ruwas pisa?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: aqeh gi lungulungun mu ku inkahulan mu, muwa’ na kahuwayun ti pasayug ku rngu’ ta’ mha cu uwi.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: baaq si cubalay i tuminun cu capang, ima’ ku pinasibaq isu’?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: yaki’ mu, ihya’ cubalay ku capaang na baaq i tuminun cu capang i tinqalangan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: micuwa’ su’ ka miki makibaq cu tatinun cu capang?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: Gaga’ niyam cubalay ku tuminun cu capang, paluhingaw ta’ ku Gaga’ mha ci lumanglung.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: balayq cubalay i nubuun ku quwaw na turakis ka hani.
pinuquwaw mu nanak yo!
baaq su’ cubalay! ingasug i puquwawun qu?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: bali baqun, ani ini’ kaanga’ ga tugal, imagal cu buwating, quga kaingasugun cuqaang i lumqing lawwi. ubugan, hupungun, basawan han ku mami’ na turakis. paqupaqun cu manbaxbux ku tamul, anabalabalayqun i umimag kinku mami’ na turakis ru tukuraun ca matapah, tuwangan lawwi cu masamag kinku mami’ na turakis ka tala’tu’ na tinahuk ka qusiya’ ru’ tarahrahgan i umumuk sumirhu la. ingasug sukuun ga ararruwa i masiukas ku mami’ na turakis ru payux uwi i buqan a quwaw ru’ sahahiya’ cubalabalay i nubuun. puquwaw na riax cu balayq na quwaw! kaa kugi i numaga’…!
S.TRANSL: 不一定，快則起碼三、五個月，甚或更久。將小米浸泡、蒸熟、冷卻後，將酒麴搗碎成粉末狀均灑於小米飯上並充分攪拌均勻，裝入罈甕裡，再淋上一定比例的冷開水，就可以封蓋存窖了。越久小米飯越溶解，酒液量也越多且越陳越香醇。讓時光釀出一罈美酒喽！耐心等待吧…

Depends on the situation, but it takes at least three to five months or even longer. After soaking, steaming, and cooling the millet, the koji is pounded into powdered form, sprinkled on top of the millet, stirred well, packed into urns, and poured with a certain percentage of cold boiled water, then sealed and stored in a cellar. The longer the rice is stored, the more it dissolves, the more fluid the sake becomes, and the better the flavor. Let time brew the wine! Wait patiently

S.FORM: nanuwan ku kiya si patgibinasun?
kiya a laciyaw ru qinug i runi, pinumuwa’ mu nanak kahabaag yo!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: piya’ pila’ i binasun ka kawsa’?
usayng kabhul cu maymal pila’ kahabaag.
balayq mu ku siyatu’ ka hani, piya’ pila’?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: imagal kabhul pila’ ku hani.
mamati’ cuqaang la, pakaaqeh i mahnuk tikay qu?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: aqeh, sihwi’ cuqaang ga pakaukas tikay a inagal mi la.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: uwal la! nanu’ malay ci cku magauu’ ka siyatu’ ka haca.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: alaw mu ku saliwa’ kinku balayan ka haca.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mapusal kabhul pila’ kahabaag, tinuting mu nanak na qaba’ ku hani, pakingasug cubalay i siptawwaw.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: kalanay mu cku rawirawin mu mha uwah mabaynay, balayq i mahnuk tikay qu?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: uwal la! huwianay mi su’ cu sapaat kabhul.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: uwah mitaal ga! kiya kahabaag matibaay cu siyatu’, qabubu’.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: piya’ pila’ ku situwing?
qutux siyatu’ ga tugal kabhul maymal pila’, magalpu kabhul pila’ i tugal.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: hanuan qutux ku binasun mu, bayqi ci cu giqas.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: lawkah su’! pabaynay ci cu papaah ru siyam na maqaw.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: si’naqru’ matibaay ku papaah la, kiya na’ a miyafun na tana’, pabaynay su’ qu?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: uwal la! bayqi ci cu qutux, muwahay ci mabaynay i babaw lawwi.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: uwal! tukuraanay mi su’ ca ubut, muwani ga maymal habangan.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
